unnormalised: Exam Prep Apps: Are They the New Biryani for Indian Students?
normalised: Exam Prep Apps: Are They the New Biryani for Indian Students?

unnormalised: Ed-Tech is buzzing! Forget endless nights cramming with dusty textbooks. Exam prep apps are becoming the go-to study buddy for students across India, from Kanpur to Kochi.
normalised: Ed-Tech is buzzing! Forget endless nights cramming with dusty textbooks. Exam prep apps are becoming the go to study buddy for students across India, from Kanpur to Kochi.

unnormalised: Need help acing that IIT-JEE? There's an app for that. Freaking out about your Class 10 board exams? Yep, app for that too!
normalised: Need help acing that I I T-J E E? There is an app for that. Freaking out about your Class ten board exams? Yep, app for that too!

unnormalised: These apps offer everything from mock tests and personalized learning to doubt-clearing sessions with expert tutors – all at your fingertips. Many even gamify the learning experience, making studying less of a chore and more, dare we say, fun?
normalised: These apps offer everything from mock tests and personalized learning to doubt clearing sessions with expert tutors—all at your fingertips. Many even gamify the learning experience, making studying less of a chore and more, dare we say, fun?

unnormalised: "Earlier, during Onam vacation, I'd be stressed about catching up. This year, thanks to 'StudyChamp' I felt much more relaxed," says Priya Nair, a student from Thiruvananthapuram.
normalised: “Earlier, during Onam vacation, I would be stressed about catching up. This year, thanks to 'StudyChamp' I felt much more relaxed,” says Priya Nair, a student from Thiruvananthapuram.

unnormalised: But are they *too* good to be true? Some worry about the potential for over-reliance on tech and the Rs. 4,999+ price tags some subscriptions carry. Still, the trend is undeniable. Will these apps become as essential as a good plate of biryani after a long study session? Only time will tell!
normalised: But are they too good to be true? Some worry about the potential for over reliance on tech and the rupee four thousand nine hundred and ninety nine plus price tags some subscriptions carry. Still, the trend is undeniable. Will these apps become as essential as a good plate of biryani after a long study session? Only time will tell!
